# posthog_experiment (Resource)

PostHog experiment.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "posthog_experiment" "checkout" {
  project_id       = 12345
  name             = "Checkout flow test"
  feature_flag_key = "checkout-experiment"

  variants = {
    control = {
      percentage = 50
    }
    test = {
      percentage = 50
    }
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `feature_flag_key` (String) Key for the feature flag that controls this experiment.
- `name` (String) Name of the experiment.
- `project_id` (Number) Identifier of the project the experiment belongs to.
- `variants` (Attributes Map) Experiment variants. Must include 'control' as the first variant. Percentages must sum to 100. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--variants))

### Optional

- `description` (String) Description of the experiment.
- `end_date` (String) End date of the experiment (ISO 8601 format).
- `start_date` (String) Start date of the experiment (ISO 8601 format).

### Read-Only

- `feature_flag_id` (Number) Identifier of the feature flag created for this experiment.
- `id` (Number) Identifier of the experiment.

<a id="nestedatt--variants"></a>
### Nested Schema for `variants`

Required:

- `percentage` (Number) Rollout percentage for this variant.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
terraform import posthog_experiment.checkout 12345:67890
```
